thread.title: Mourinho: Referee was weak and naive
thread.title_full: Mourinho: Referee was weak and naive

author: Lamar Odom reportedly released from Las Vegas hospital
title: Mourinho: Referee was weak and naive
text:
Mourinho: Referee was weak and naive Goal.com 8 hrs ago © Provided by Goal.com Chelsea boss Jose Mourinho branded referee Damir Skomina "weak and naive" for failing to award Chelsea a penalty in the first half of its 0-0 draw with Dynamo Kiev on Tuesday.
AdChoices The Portuguese was handed a $77,200 fine and a one-game suspended stadium ban last week by the Football Association after accusing referees in the Premier League of being "afraid" to award his side spot kicks following a 3-1 home loss to Southampton.
Mourinho was particularly irked at being sanctioned while rival Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger escaped for using the term "weak and naive" towards match officials.
And in a nod to Wenger, Mourinho dragged up the phrase once again when asked to comment on a first-half incident in Ukraine which saw Cesc Fabregas seemingly felled by Dynamo defender Sergiy Rybalka.
Speaking to BT Sport, Mourinho said: "The referee was weak and naive. It was a big penalty.
"I do not understand what the referee behind the goal does – he doesn't make a decision," Mourinho continued When it's 0-0 and such a penalty is not given it's a huge moment. Once more it was a game without luck. A little bit of luck and we would win."
John Terry was in agreement with Mourinho over the penalty incident but was keen to look forward to Chelsea’s upcoming fixtures.
"The first half was better than the second," Terry said. We created a few chances; Willian's free kick that hit the bar and a penalty that was, for me, but was not given.
"But we move on. We will go back to the Bridge and move on. It's on us now. Maybe we could've got three points tonight. It's in our hands and we're comfortable with that."
